intro: Giliastrum ludens, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. It has compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Giliastrum ludens is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in harsh, arid conditions.
